summary: The 'Cybersecurity in Agriculture Act of 2025' directs the Secretary of Agriculture to establish a program for Agriculture Cybersecurity Centers. The program will award grants/enter agreements with eligible entities (land-grant colleges) to create five Regional Centers. These centers will conduct research, develop tools, and provide training to enhance cybersecurity in the agricultural sector, focusing on threats from specific countries. The Act also mandates the establishment of a national network and a coordinating entity for these centers and authorizes $25 million annually from 2026-2030.
